// DISCOVERY Mountains in Cebu
Falls in Cebu
Beaches in Cebu
Festivals in Cebu
Foods in Cebu Musics in Cebu
Aguinid Falls Aguinid Falls is one of more than 11 waterfalls of the town of Samboan and perhaps the most popular of them all. It lies along the calcium-rich Tangbo River making the water beautifully turquoise and warm. Santander - Barili - Toledo Rd, Samboan, Cebu N/A N/A https://www.thepinaysolobackpacker.com/aguinid-falls/
Tumalog Falls Tumalog Falls, also called as "Toslob falls" or "Mag-ambak falls" situated in barangay Luka, southern part of Cebu, Philippines. It takes approximately two and a half hours to get to the area from Cebu City. Cebu South Rd, Oslob, Cebu Friday Open 24 hours \n\nSaturday 8am–5pm \n\nSunday 8am–5pm \n\nMonday Open 24 hours \n\nTuesday Open 24 hours \n\nWednesday Open 24 hours \n\nThursday Open 24 hours
0943 415 0072 http://meanttogo.com/get-awed-by-the-beauty-and-grandeur-of-tumalog-falls-in-oslob-cebu/
Kawasan Falls Kawasan Falls is one of the Philippines most famous waterfalls, and also one of the most famous in the world. Kawasan Falls is known to be a tropical oasis with big bamboo rafts that can take you around the turquoise natural pool, and under the waterfall. Badian, 6031 Cebu OPEN 24 HRS 0918 654 4111 https://www.christineabroad.com/kawasan-falls-guide/
Mantayupan Falls Barili, a municipality located at the southwest portion of Cebu, derived the towns name from a local grass that abundantly grows in the area called balili.One of Barilis tourist attractions is the Mantayupan Falls which is one of the highest waterfalls in the province. The falls is also locally known as the Ambakan Falls. Cebu, Barili, Unnamed Road Friday 7am–5pm \n\nSaturday 7am–5pm \n\nSunday 7am–5pm \n\nMonday 7am–5pm \n\nTuesday 7am–5pm \n\nWednesday 7am–5pm \n\nThursday 7am–5pm
N/A https://www.choosephilippines.com/go/water-forms/4193/mantayupan-falls
BINALAYAN HIDDEN WATERFALLS “Beautiful things don’t ask for attention,” adventurer-photojournalist Sean O’Connell told Life negative assets manager Walter Mitty after seeing a magnificent but rare snow leopard through his camera. It may be just a quote from the 2013 adventure-comedy-drama movie The Secret Life of Walter Mitty. But the phrase rings true in real life—and in many destinations. The municipality of Samboan has its own gorgeous hidden wonder called Binalayan Falls in Barangay Bonbon. Bonbon, Samboan, Cebu、 Friday 8am–5pm \n\nSaturday 8am–5pm \n\nSunday 8am–5pm \n\nMonday 8am–5pm \n\nTuesday 8am–5pm \n\nWednesday 8am–5pm \n\nThursday 8am–5pm N/A https://adrenalineromance.com/2016/03/04/binalayan-hidden-falls-three-flows-of-magic-beauty-and-charm/
DAU WATERFALLS For most Filipinos, staving off the intense tropical heat means going to the beaches. But what if you want to do something different? What if you are tired of crowded beaches but still want to go some place where you could cool off? Then head off to Samboan, the beautiful waterfall capital of southern Cebu. There you can take a cool, refreshing plunge in their pristine and magnificent waterfalls. One of those stunning natural wonders is the picturesque Dau Falls Santander - Barili - Toledo Rd, Samboan, Cebu N/A N/A https://adrenalineromance.com/2016/02/26/dau-falls-cooling-off-at-samboans-highest-waterfall//
MONTANEZA WATERFALLS The Montaneza River threads its way through a narrow ravine. It is a perfect setting for an unforgettable canyon tour. We abseil a set of five different waterfalls, climbing and jumping down the rapids. Once you rappel the first waterfall, there is no return anymore. On of the high lights are the descending of a 30 meter high waterfall with an overhang. On the end of the tour there are natural hot springs , where you can take a bath and relax after a very exciting adventure. The adrenaline pumping thrill and fun combined with incredible tropical nature is something you will remember for a long time. Montañeza,, Malabuyoc, Cebu N/A N/A https://www.thepinaysolobackpacker.com/inambakan-falls-travel-guide-itinerary-budget/
Osmeña Peak Osmeña Peak, the highest mountain in Cebu is a cluster of green jagged hills like a deformed twin of Chocolate Hills of Bohol hugging the shorelines of Badian. Mantalongon, Dalaguete 6022, Philippines N/A +N/A https://www.thepinaysolobackpacker.com/osmena-peak-dalaguete-cebu//
Mt. Naupa Mt. Naupa is located in the City of Naga..the hike is perfect for that adrenalin craving especially for the beginners. Naga, Cebu N/A N/A https://chasingpotatoes.com/2016/06/06/mt-naupa-climbing-the-almost-perfect-cone-of-nagas-highest-peak/
Mt. Kan-Irag (Sirao Peak) Sirao Peak is famous for trekkers as it is one of the most accessible mountains within the city. It has that picturesque green meadow panoramic scene below when you’re at its peak. Barangay Sibugay, Cebu City N/A N/A https://theficklefeet.com/mt-kan-irag/
Mt. Mauyog Mt. Mauyog has a towering height of 1,027 meters above sea level. It is also one of the popular hiking destinations my province (Cebu )because of its human brain look-like formation. Hikers usually visit this place and proceed to Mt Manunggal or vice versa for a day hike. Balamban, Cebu N/A N/A https://thewanderingitinerant.com/2017/09/01/traversing-mt-manunggal-mt-mauyog-a-random-journey/
Mt. Manunggal Mount Manunggal is the highest mountain in the island of Cebu located in Barangay Magsaysay in Balamban, Cebu province, rising 3,599 ft. above sea level. It is the site of the crash of the presidential plane Mt. Pinatubo which killed President Ramon Magsaysay and twenty-four others on March 17, 1957 Barangay Magsaysay in Balamban, Cebu N/A N/A http://www.facecebu.net/2017/09/a-trek-to-historic-peak-mt-manunggal.html
Mt. Lanaya Mt. Lanaya is located at the municipality of Alegria, Cebu and it is considered one of the most difficult mountains in Cebu. Because of its constant 70 degrees ascent, every hiker will surely sweat a lot and break their legs from their treacherous trek. Barangay Legaspi, Alegría, Cebu N/A N/A https://www.sojournsandstories.com/2017/05/09/mt-lanaya-guide/
Sinulog Festival People shouts "Viva Pit Señor". The Sinulog is Cebu Citys most popular and grandest festival. It is celebrated every 3rd Sunday of January in honor of the Señor Sto. Niño. Foreign and local tourists flock to Cebu City for this celebration and join in the procession and the grand mardi gras. The Sinulog is a dance-prayer expressing devotion to the Holy Child. it is popular belief among Cebuanos that this dance-prayer is the most effective way of getting favors from the Sto. Niño. This festival is world-renowed and the most extravagant festival in Cebu. The Sinulog festival is celebrated in honour of the holy child Senior Santo Niño. The highlights in this festivities is the street dancing where merrymakers dance to the beat of the pit senor drums. LOREM IPSUM DOLOR 3rd Sunday of January (Cebu City) - -
Tagbo Festival It is celebrated every January in honor of patron Sto. Niño de Poro. Beloved memoir of a living past, Tagbo is the corner stone from which this great municipality has sprung. Rich in cultural heritage and deep in spiritual values, Tagbo is a very significant event precluding the birth of a town very dear to the hearts of her sons and daughters. LOREM IPSUM DOLOR 19th of January (Poro, Camotes Island) - -
Silmugi Festival "Silmugi" is an old name of the town of Borbon and the festival is in honor of its patron saint for the bountiful harvest. The street dancing which is one of the highlights is participated in by the different barangays. LOREM IPSUM DOLOR 20th of January (Borbon) - -
Bodbod Festival The town of Catmon is famous for its tasty "bodbod" and thus is the focus of the festival. The street dancing competition is participated by the different barangays has its dance movements, the movement of making the bodbod with the costumes in bodbod concept. - 10th Of February (Catmon) - -
Kabayo Festival Organized by the Cebu Equine Owners, Breeders and Sportsmen Association (CEOBSA), the Kabayo festival is supported by the DOT. The festival promotes sports tourism, ecotourism and agri-industrial tourism awareness in the country. The highlights include the parade of horses, horse racing competition and the best decorated "tartanillas" or horse drawn carriages and features a bazaar and flea market. - February - Movable (Mandaue City) - -
Sarok festival The festival is part of the towns commemoration of their founding anniversary. It is a mardi gras parade and street dancing along the main thoroughfares with participants using a creative design of "sarok", a native hat used by the farmers to protect them from the heat of the sun. - 14th of February (Consolacion) - -
Soli-Soli Festival named after the soli-soli plant which abounds around the lake Danao which is used for mat, bags and hat weaving and other handicrafts. its freestyle street dancing competition uses soli-soli plant as its dominant material. The festival adds color to the feast of St. Joseph the Worker. - 18th March (San Francisco, Camotes Island) - -
Tostado Festival The festival focuses on the towns famous delicacy, the "tostado". The street dancing which is the highlight of the festivity uses the different movements of making tostado in the dance participated in by the different barangays. - 3rd Sunday of April (Santander) - -
Haladaya Festival Starts on Easter Sunday and ends with a street dancing on the seventh day after Easter. Haladaya means "Halad kang Datu Day", the leader of the first Malayan settlers in Daan bantayan. Highlights include the fluvial aprade where patron saints of the different barangays will be placed in decorated bancas or motorized outrigger boats and paraded in the sea. - Easter Sunday (Daan Bantayan) - -
Kabanhawan Festival Showcases the "Sugat" in which the town is known for many years since. The street dancing depicts the joy felt by the believers when Christ is resurrected. The celebration is grander since it will be followed by a day long games and entertainment that highlights the endowment of Minglanillas history, trade and arts.. - Easter Sunday (Minglanilla) - -
Bahug-bahug sa Mactan or Kadaugan sa Mactan A weeklong commemoration of the historic battle of Mactan between the Spanish Conquestador Fernando Magallanes and Mactan Chieftain Lapu-Lapu. The festival features various activities highlighted by the series of musical productions culminating with the famous battle, food street and live band entertainment. - 22nd - 27th of April (Lapu-Lapu City) - -
Rico’s Lechon We asked locals where we could find the best lechon and they all pointed us to Rico’s Lechon, pioneer of the famous Spicy Lechon. Owner Enrico Dionson likes to keep things simple–his roasted lechon is only seasoned with traditional herbs and spices and has always been since he opened the business in 1997. \n\nTheir slogan, “Da Best Gyud”, lives up to our expectations. Indeed, it’s a lechon worthy of being called the best in Cebu. The restaurant also likes to stay ahead by adding Pinoy favorites to the menu other than lechon.. Rico’s Lechon – Mabolo Branch (F. Cabahug St, Cebu City, Cebu) Monday- Sunday 10:00am-10:00pm (032)260–2443 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/12/cebu-food-trip.html
The Pig and Palm The Pig and Palm is a Modern Spanish Tapas restaurant in Cebu by renowned British chef, Jason Atherton, and his Cebuana wife, Irha. \n\nChef Jason earned his first Michelin Star in 2011 and has worked with some of the greats, like Nico Ladenis and Ferran Adria at elBulli, and oversaw the opening of 5 ‘Maze’ Restaurants with Gordon Ramsay.
MSY Tower, Pescadores Rd. Cebu Business Park, Cebu City) Tuesday – Friday 7:30am-12am \n\nSaturday – Sunday 8am-12am
+63 32 255–8249 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/12/cebu-food-trip.html
Tymad Bistro Tymad Bistro is our go-to place for authentic French pastries and dishes in Cebu! Owned by a French Chef, Philippe Estienne, who settled in Cebu with his Filipina wife, the bistro is popular for their perfectly buttery, light, and flaky croissants, chocolats, and kouign amann–all baked fresh daily.
Maria Luisa Road Banilad, Cebu
Monday – Closed \n\nTuesday to Thursday – 7:00am-10:00pm \n\nFriday to Saturday – 10:00am-11:00pm \n\nSunday – 10:00am-10:00pm
(032) 239 7385 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/12/cebu-food-trip.html
Circa 1900 Circa 1900 is a casual dining restaurant that focuses on incorporating local technics and ingredients into international cuisine. Circa 1900 offers an eclectic menu with plenty of choices that range from the familiar to the exotic. Cebu City has always drawn skilled chefs to the local culinary scene, many of whom are continually carving out their reputations in the “Queen City of The South,” making Cebu one of the Philippines’ gastronomic hotspots.
Sanjercas Ville Ext Rd Cebu City, Cebu) Daily From 11am – 12 am (032) 239 6265 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/12/cebu-food-trip.html
Matias BBQ One favorite street food of Pinoys is barbecue–pork or chicken meat or giblets skewered on sticks and cooked over a charcoal grill. For Cebuanos, the go-to place for barbecue is Matias in Mandaue City. Nestled under the shade of sweet star apple trees, this open-air eatery sells very affordable pork barbecue, chicken barbecue, chorizo, pork belly, balbacua, and other local dishes.
Matias BBQ (A. S. Fortuna Street, Banilad, Mandaue City) Monday – Sunday, 11:30 AM to 10 PM (32) 3452164, (32) 3469123 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/12/cebu-food-trip.html
Johnna’s Liempo Haus : Ask any of the locals for the original liempo in Balamban and they’ll direct you to Johnna’s Liempo Haus. \n\nBalamban, located in the western part of Cebu, is known for its distinctive method of grilling Liempo using traditional herbs and spices, similar to how you would prepare Lechon Cebu
Balamban Public Market Monday – Sunday, 11:30 AM to 10 PM +63 918 206–5607 https://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2016/10/johnnas-liempo-the-original-balamban-liempo.html
Zubuchon – Best Lechon in Cebu I shall jump straight to the best thing that I had in Cebu – Zubuchon lechon (whole roasted pig). All you need to know is Zubuchon has the best lechon. You MUST TRY it if you are in Cebu. Besides the famous lechon (P240 half kilo or SGD$7/P450 for 1kg or SGD$13.2), we also had the equally good Lechon Sisig (P190). Zubuchon has other dishes like Lechon Crispy Pata (P450 or SGD$13), Roasted Pork Belly (P380 or SGD$11) and Slow-Cooked Pork Belly (P220 or SGD$6.5) on the menu. \n\nNote: Zubuchon is no longer at Banilad Town Center.
Zubuchon Lechon (One Mango Mall General Maxilom Ave, Cebu City) Monday – Sunday, 12:00 PM to ( PM : +63 32 2395697 https://www.ladyironchef.com/2011/10/10-things-to-eat-cebu-philippines/
Paradise Beach Bantayan Island Paradise Beach is a secluded beach in the southern part of Bantayan Island. It is reportedly owned by the same owners of Santa Fe Beach Club and Ogtong Cave Resort but lack of road access has prevented the building of a resort here. Santa Fe Cebu N/A N/A https://sugbo.ph/2017/budget-sta-fe-bantayan-island/
Lambug Public Beach The splendid Lambug Beach is still a well kept secret. Even this Beach with powder white sand, lined up with coconut trees and crystal clear water is the dream beach of all nature enthusiasts, it is still an almost unknown paradise. Come to Lambug Beach at Badian and enjoy wonderful and relaxed moments away from the busy life in pure nature. Lambug Beach Rd, Badian, Cebu N/A N/A https://www.sojournsandstories.com/2017/04/26/lambug-beach-badian/
Bounty Beach Bounty Beach is located in the southern part of Malapascua, a small island off the northeastern coast of Cebu. To get here from Cebu, take a boat from the port of Maya. Several ferry services operate during the day, but they don’t always adhere to the timetable, tending to depart when a boat is full of passengers. Some diving centers offer transfer services to the island. Bounty Beachfront, Daanbantayan, Cebu N/A N/A https://www.expedia.com.ph/Bounty-Beach-Daanbantayan.d6252414.Place-To-Visit
Hermit’s Cove This beautiful cove is tucked below the cliff which overlooks the blue sea and towards the Tañon Strait. The cove’s beach is white and clean. Its water is clear, and it is lined with coconut trees and other plants and verdant trees. Kantabogon Rd, Aloguinsan, Cebu N/A N/A https://outoftownblog.com/hermits-cove-aloguinsans-best-kept-secret/#.XFRrxfZuLIU
Basdaku Beach Basdaku beach, located in Moalboal, has a one kilometer white sandy coastline. There are many beach resorts in the area so you will have a lot of choices when you go there. 6 Kilometers away from basdaku, there’s also another beach called the Panagsama beach. Unfortunately, the place was blown a typhoon in 1984. So most tourists who plans to have the white sand beach experience choose basdaku. Basdaku, Moalboal, Cebu N/A N/A http://www.travellingthephilippines.info/basdaku-beach-in-moalboal/
Langub Beach Sugar Beach is the kilometer-long sugary brown-colored sand beach in Sipalay. It is an ideal destination for those who want to relax and unwind after exploring the underrated idyllic city of Sipalay in Negros Occidental. Sit back, relax and unwind while lazing on the sand and watching the sunset. Sugar Beach, Barangay Nauhang, Negros Occidental N/A N/A https://www.philippinebeaches.org/sugar-beach-langub-beach-negros-occidental-important-tips/
Waterfront Cebu City Hotel and Casino Lorem Ipsum Dolor Salinas Dr. 6000 Cebu City N/A +63 32 232 6888 http://www.waterfronthotels.com.ph/waterfront/waterfront-cebu-city-hotel-and-casino/
SM City Cebu - Northwing Lorem Ipsum Dolor North Reclamation Area 6000 Cebu City N/A +63 32 231 0557 https://www.smsupermalls.com/
Pacific Grand Ballroom Lorem Ipsum Dolor : Waterfront Cebu City Hotel and Casino, Salinas Drive, Lahug, 6000 Cebu City
N/A +63 32 232 6888 http://www.waterfronthotels.com.ph/waterfront/waterfront-cebu-city-hotels-casino//
Radisson Blu Hotel - Lobby Lounge Lorem Ipsum Dolor Radisson Blu Hotel 6000 Cebu City N/A N/A http://internetworks.tumblr.com/
Cubana Lorem Ipsum Dolor Gen. Maxilom Ave (aka Mango Ave) (btwn Gotianuy St anf F. Manalo St) 6000 Cebu City N/A N/A http://twitter.com/@cubanacebu
Marshalls Irish Pub Lorem Ipsum Dolor Mango Square, Mango Ave. (Juana Osmena St.)6000 Cebu City N/A +63 917 631 2413 marshallsirishpub.com
Open Mic Lorem Ipsum Dolor Labangon 6000 Cebu City N/A +63 917 327 7168 N/A
Blue Bar and Hill at Marco Polo Plaza Lorem Ipsum Dolor Nivel Hills Cebu City N/A +63 32 253 1111 https://www.facebook.com/pages/Blu-Bar-and-Grill/1800084210308815 //END

//Onboarding Screen Desc Next Skip TRANSLATOR Translates English words into two languages (Filipino, Cebuano) LANGUAGE DIRECTIONS Helps you find a place in Cebu such as tourist spots DICTIONARY Contains words of languages alphabetically arranged with meanings opening Feel free to use me !
//Discoveries Part Show All Sea Turtle Lagoon Basilica Minore del Santo Niño Cebu Taoist Temple Cebu Westown Lagoon Fort San Pedro Hike Mt Babag Anzani Circa 1900 Top of Cebu Tavolata Abaka Baking Company Abaseria Deli and Cafe Wish Bar Lounge Restaurant Blu Bar and Grill Morals and Malice Bar Trademark Bar and Lounge Jump Shot Sports Bar Sirao Peak Hiking Oslob Whale Sharks Kawasan Falls
Natural Wonder Snorkeling Mountain Hiking Top Activities Summer Gate Away Catholic Church Vibrant Horticulture display Top Restaurants Mountain Top Restaurant One of the BEST Italian Restaurants in Cebu! Fantastic Breakfast Place Artisan crafted breads Kasambagan- Casual Dining All-in-one Outdoors Top Places Decent Draft Microbrews Top Bars/Nightlife American, Brew Pub, Asian, Grill, Pub Moonlit Wine Dinner Where art meets alcohol Superbly Crafted Cocktails Sports Bar with pool table Detailed description of the attraction show in map
The Fort San Pedro (or the Fuerte de San Pedro in Spanish) is a military defence structure in Cebu. It was built by the Spaniards under the command of Miguel Lopez de Legazpi, the first governor of Captaincy General of the Philippines. The original fort built right after the arrival of Legaspi and his expedition was made of wood. It was then replaced in the 17th century with a stone fort to repel Muslim raiders.
Up for a challenging trek? Lace up your hiking boots, and go for a slightly challenging hike up Mount Babag – a playground and practice ground for seasoned mountaineers in Cebu.
Go on a hiking adventure to Sirao Peak, or also known as Mount Kan-Irag, and drink in the magnificent vistas from the top. Better yet, pitch a tent, camp, and see the Metro Cebu glitter from the summit at night.
Undoubtedly, one of the most popular — talking about worldwide recognition — tourist attractions in Cebu is the Whale Shark Watching or Swimming with the Whale Sharks in Oslob, Southern Cebu. And here’s everything you need to know about this famous yet controversial spot in Cebu.
The Kawasan Falls is an inviting natural wonder that delights its visitors with its dashing ice-cool waters, breathtaking natural backdrop, and relaxing vibe. A favorite weekend getaway among city dwellers in Cebu, this spectacular waterfall also has a plethora of adventures to offer to outdoor aficionados, including trekking, rock climbing, canyoneering, waterfall jumping and rapelling.
Cebu Westown Lagoon. A surprisingly refreshing oasis for the travel-weary tourists ideally situated in the midst of two bustling cities, Cebu and Mandaue. Guests could unwind as they dip in the breathtaking man-made lagoon or simply soak their cares away in two outdoor soothing Jacuzzi pools. Modern, spacious and well-appointed rooms exude the feel of a” home away from home”.
Cebu Taoist Temple (Chinese: 宿霧定光寶殿) is a Taoist temple located in Beverly Hills Subdivision of Cebu City, Philippines. The temple is built by Cebus substantial Chinese community in 1972.[1] With an elevation of 110 metres (360 ft) above sea level, the temple is a towering, multi-tiered, multi-hued attraction accessible by three separate winding routes.
Still looking for the perfect place for your next summer getaway? Check out the Sea Turtle Lagoon Resort in Tabogon, Northern Cebu.Tabogon is the town situated in between Borbon and Bogo City. It’s a long travel but once you get to the place, it will all be worth it. It’s one of the most remote and relatively less developed in Cebu yet blessed with natural sceneries — like a “paradise on earth” where the sea and heaven meet.From the interesting rock formations to the vast ocean where sea turtles appear, to the flowers and trees that surround the resort, the Sea Turtle Lagoon Resort is indeed a refreshing getaway place Though there’s no swimming pool in the resort, the vitamin sea is all you need. You can also arrange a bangka tour going to Bogo City’s Capitancillo Islet.
The Basílica Minore del Santo Niño de Cebú (Minor Basilica of the Holy Child of Cebú) commonly known as the Santo Niño Basilica, is a minor basilica in Cebu City in the Philippines that was founded in the 1565 by Fray Andrés de Urdaneta, O.S.A. and Fray Diego de Herrera, O.S.A.. The oldest Roman Catholic church in the country, it is built on the spot where the image of the Santo Niño de Cebú was found during the expedition of Miguel López de Legazpi.
Anzani Restaurant brings a taste of New Mediterranean cuisine to Cebu. Owned by couple Chef Marco and Kate Anzani, it serves a unique type of cuisine described as a blend of coastal Mediterranean flavors, basically consisting of tomatoes, olives, chickpeas, herbs, lemon, and cheese.
A cluster of ancestral residences restored into a lifestyle and leisure destination, a quick escape from the hectic lifestyle in the growing city of Cebu.Circa 1900 Casa Uno was opened on March 2014 by Executive Chef Steve and his wife, Eya Shrimski. The property is a colonial house restored into a restaurant, piano bar and function venue in which great efforts have been taken to retain the original architecture and material of its era.
With Metro Cebu’s apparent economic boom with its unstoppable growing number of skyscrapers, it would definitely be an amazing experience to witness a panoramic view of the city’s undeniably beautiful skyline. Opened just last August 2017, Tops of Cebu is the newest mountain-top restaurant in Busay that offers not just delectable dishes, but also an incredible experience to be on top of Cebu.
TAVOLATA is an Italian bistro that serves simple Italian dishes from The Abaca Group (known for really yummy Cebu restaurants like Maya Mexican Restaurant and Abaca Restaurant in Mactan.)Its name means “to gather around a table“, and the restaurant is designed to be a great place to hang out with friends or to celebrate special occasions.It uses the finest ingredients from Italy like Finestra in Solaire, and has that informal feel,stylish ambiance and cult following like Wildflour in Manila.
OUR FROM SCRATCH BAKERY AND CAFÉ CONCEPT FEATURING THE FINEST CROISSANTS, BAKED GOODS AND PASTRIES IN THE METRO. WE SERVE ALL DAY BREAKFAST, AS WELL AS COMFORT CLASSICS IN SELECT LOCATIONS AROUND THE CITY. JOIN US FOR THE FINEST COFFEES AND CONCOCTIONS IN CEBU.
Situated in a serene area of Cebu City, Abaseria Deli and Café is a popular dining place for many locals and tourists.The Abaseria is well-loved for their delicious authentic Filipino dishes. Customers can enjoy delicacies from various Philippine cities and provinces. Their meals are quite affordable, which makes it more attractive to diners. Most of their dishes cost Php60 to Php150. With a Php200 budget, you can already enjoy a complete meal.
Wish Cebu is a Bar, Lounge, and Restaurant located at Plaza Nouvelle, Unit 3, 2E. Benedicto Street Cebu.It features a cozy ambience, great music, sumptuous food and mouthwatering drinks.Wish Cebu is a good chill out place for night out between friends.
Seafood on ice, it said on the menu. It doesn’t quite describe the delight of an appetizer that formally started our Moonlit Wine Dinner at the Blu Bar and Grill of Marco Polo Plaza Cebu. Smoke enveloped the dish as it was brought to the table over exclamations of amazement, a pair each of fresh shrimps, mussels, scallops served atop a block of ice shaped like a bowl.
BInfused with cloves, cinnamon, a hint of ginger and cardamom or a mix of cream cheese, salted caramel, blended oatmeal cookies or even honey, lemon juice, rosemary and fig syrup, your regular coffee, smoothie, or cocktail become so much more at Cebu’s new lifestyle destination Morals and Malice.
Trademark Bar and Lounge is one of the best nightlife locations in Cebu. Specializing in Hip hop, R and B, and Trap music, Trademark is designed for those who are looking for amazing music, warm ambiance, and the best service Cebu has to offer
Home town sports bar with pool table, western and local food, darts, live music, great drink deals and a friendly staff. Doing our best to be your home away from home......Coming from Banilad on AS Fortuna...just before JCenter mall on the left across from the Petron station (above M Lhuellier) Parking behind the bar shared with Nonki
